# List of ambassadors of the Central African Republic to China

|last =
|abolished =
|succession =
|deputy =
|salary =
|website =
}}
The Central African ambassador in Beijing is the official representative of the Government in Bangui to the Government of the People's Republic of China.

|Michel Gallin-Douathe
|Ambassador Michel Gallin-Douathe of the CAF said his country spoke out of experience with Beijing's subversive undertakings. The Central African Republic accepted a Red Chinese "embassy", he said, only to find that Beijing was trying to organize a "people's army" to crush the host country. October 18, 1960 he became ambassador to Washington, D.C.
